title: How to Make Ginger Beer

steps.headline: Make sure you sterilise the bottle before adding any ingredients!
Pour the sugar and yeast into the bottle.
Mix the grated ginger with the lemon juice and honey.
steps.description: Add more honey if you like the flavour.

steps.headline: Pour the mixture into the bottle.
Fill the bottle roughly half with water.
Screw on the cap and shake until most of the sugar has dissolved.
Fill the bottle to the top leaving a gap at the top for expansion of the gas.
Screw on the cap and place the bottle in a warm place for 48 hours
Check to see if the bottle is hard to squeeze.
steps.description: If it feels hard then its ready.. If its got some give then leave it another 24 hours or until needed.

steps.headline: Place the bottle in the fridge for a couple of hours.
steps.description: This stops the yeast from working.

steps.headline: Pass the liquid through a sieve to remove the ginger and lemon seeds.
Serve on a hot summers day!

text: Make sure you sterilise the bottle before adding any ingredients!  Pour the sugar and yeast into the bottle. Shake to combine. Mix the grated ginger with the lemon juice and honey. Add more honey if you like the flavour. Pour the mixture into the bottle.  Fill the bottle roughly half with water.  Screw on the cap and shake until most of the sugar has dissolved.  Fill the bottle to the top leaving a gap at the top for expansion of the gas.  Screw on the cap and place the bottle in a warm place for 48 hours  Check to see if the bottle is hard to squeeze. If it feels hard then its ready.. If its got some give then leave it another 24 hours or until needed. Place the bottle in the fridge for a couple of hours. This stops the yeast from working. Pass the liquid through a sieve to remove the ginger and lemon seeds.  Serve on a hot summers day!  Your beer is now finished. Enjoy!
